definition: Dante Alighieri (1265-1321), Italian poet, author of the Divine Comedy 神曲
but/yet/however/only/merely/still
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
surname Ding

sentences.english: Journeys, such as those portrayed by Dante and Petrarch , occur within.
sentences.chinese: 行程如但丁和彼特拉克所描绘的，发生在。

sentences.english: This is a Dante-like vision of hell.
sentences.chinese: 这里就是但丁眼中的地狱。

sentences.english: OPM: Is it true Dante can use a Guitar in DMC3?
sentences.chinese: 在三代中但丁真的能够用吉他吗？

sentences.english: As Dante climbed through a hierarchy of heavens, he ascended a hierarchy of rank.
sentences.chinese: 但丁最终攀上了九重天堂，他擢升的是地位层级。

sentences.english: The Erynes or Furies are there, and Dante is protected from looking at them.
sentences.chinese: 但丁在艾琳丝与复利斯在那里接受保护。

sentences.english: Does any one think that Alighieri has any fewer things to say than Machiavelli?
sentences.chinese: 谁能认为但丁要说的东西比马基雅弗利少些呢？

sentences.english: The tomb of Dante, exiled from his native Florence.
sentences.chinese: 但丁的坟墓从他的出生地弗伦罗萨迁到这里。

sentences.english: I travelled down the Via Dante towards the most famous area within Milan – the Piazza del Duomo.
sentences.chinese: 我穿过但丁路直接前往米兰最著名的大教堂广场。

definition: Virgil or Vergilius (70-19 BC), Roman poet and author of the Aeneid 埃涅阿斯紀|埃涅阿斯纪[Ai1 nie4 a1 si1 Ji4]
Ulysses (novel)
Raphael
Giovanni Boccaccio (1313-1375), Italian writer, poet, and humanist, author of Decameron 十日談|十日谈[Shi2 ri4 Tan2]
George Byron (1788-1824), English poet
Franz Kafka (1883-1924), Czech Jewish writer
a dandy/a fop/Don Juan/a ladies man
Hugo (name)/Victor Hugo (1802-1885), French writer
Virgil's Aeneid (epic about the foundation of Rome)
Henry (name)/henry (unit of inductance)
Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist
Shelley/abbr. for 珀西·比希·雪萊|珀西·比希·雪莱[Po4 xi1 · Bi3 xi1 · Xue3 lai2]
Sophocles (496-406 BC), Greek tragedian, author of Oedipus the King
Jorge Luis Borges
Joan Miró (1893-1983), Spanish surrealist painter
Petrarch/Francesco Petrarca (1304-1374), Italian scholar and lyric poet, famous for sonnets
